Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2011 08:41AM nannajean wrote: Hi Kira Thanks for the advise, I am wrapping and I do have a night sleeve (it looks like a elephant nose warmer- (ugh) but I wear it each night and wrap for about 2-3 hours each day and compression sleeve a couple of hours a day but if I go out or shopping I leave most of the stuff at home.  I just feel this is taking up way too much of my life and I don't know if it is doing much good. It quite honestly scares me that I will have to continue with this forever.  I want to leave the Cancer and it's baggage behind me. Nannajean
Posts.Title: Does the swelling ever go away???? nannajean Marple

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2011 07:13PM nannajean wrote: You know it just makes things better to know that you are not the only one dealing with this stuff.  I would love for the swelling to be gone but I am glad that I am here to experience this, it is for a reason and we are at least alive.  I do wrap (not the music kind) and it does help but maybe I need to wrap for 2 weeks solid and just stay around home for that time. You guys rock (not the music kind) I don't know what I would do without you all, Thanks Nannajean
Posts.Title: Does the swelling ever go away???? nannajean Marple

Posts.Content: nannajean wrote: I have had LE for the past 6 months, I've had a compression sleeve and glove, massage therapy and physio and I am not seeing too much improvement.  Since BC I have gained about 20 pounds and I am wondering if this is part of the cause.  I want all your advice on if this will ever go away, maybe not to the original size of my other arm but close to it.  I am on Femera and have heard that it can cause some water retention, also I flew to Toyko and back without a sleeve, then I really noticed that my arm was swelling. Help you guys you all have been through this, give my some advise. Nannajean Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Does the swelling ever go away???? nannajean Marple

Posts.Content: nannajean wrote: Hi I am to have my 3rd AC treatment tomorrow and I'm feeling pretty good, however I have developed a dry cough, not all the time but often throughout the day.  My Dr says he doesn't think it is anything to do with chemo and nothing to worry about, but you know any new thing kind of worries you.  Just wondering if I am alone with this sympton of if any other person is having the same thing. Thanks  nannajean Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: dry cough after chemo nannajean nannajean

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2011 03:08PM nannajean wrote: Hi Brinny I was just at physio and my affected arm is not any different but my good arm (the one with all it's nodes) has increased by 1cm in all 4 spots that she measured.  She says that of course can't be because of Lymphedemia and she is pretty sure I am retaining water.  Have any of you ladies had water retentsion from being on Femera.  I have an appt with the family dr. next Friday and I am going to ask about a water pill.  Any thoughts on this, all you wise ladies. Thanks again Nannajean
Posts.Title: Does the swelling ever go away???? nannajean Marple

Posts.Content: nannajean wrote: I just saw my surgeon yesterday and my breast cancer is 2cm, stage 3,and  all 4 of the lymphnodes they removed were positive.  I have to go back to the hospital tomorrow for an axillary dissection.  I am so scared that they will all be positive as well. I don't mind having to do the chemo and radiation but I can't stand not knowing  how far this has spread.  Please someone let me know if they have had lots of node involvement and are still here years later.  I need some good news about now, I try to stay positive but each hope for good news I have had bad. nannajean Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: new diagnoses nannajean ritajean

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2009 08:23PM nannajean wrote: Hi All I am home from hospital, I had both the ct and bone scan the day after my surgery and thank god they both came back clear. I don't mind fighting the breast cancer but don't want to fight a secondary cancer.  I am keeping well and trying to be very positive I do think I will join a support group in my area as I need to keep talking with gals who have great stories. Thanks again for all your notes of support Keeping strong and happy Nanna jean nanna jean
Posts.Title: new diagnoses nannajean ritajean

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2009 01:13PM nannajean wrote: Rita.....Thanks so much for your reply, your note made me cry with it's kindness.  It is so nice to have someone to talk to that has been thru this stuff.  Husbands, kids and friends are great but unless you have walked this journey it's just different. It's great to see your picture too I will have to do that (before I loose my hair) First, I must tell you that my cancer is (IDC) but it is not a stage 3 but a grade 3, I am new to all this cancer lingo.  I will be having a bone and CT scan to help determine the stage.  I am going in to the hospital to day for the dissection and they are keeping me until Saturday as they have booked my bone scan for Friday, so things are moving quickly for me, which is good. Do you think this is the best discussion board or should I be on connection with others with similar diagnosis? I have to leave for the hospital shortly but I intend to go in there to kick some butt and leave no cancer in my body.  This is a challange I will overcome with all my super support group here and the super support on this site. Hugs right back at you and we will be talking soon. Jean
Posts.Title: new diagnoses nannajean ritajean

Posts.Content: May 17, 2011 07:14PM nannajean wrote: After writing breathless and worried I put on my runners and took a two mile walk at a good pace, if I was sick I would have had way more problems with my walk.  I think that I took what the oncologist said and worried about it.  The truth is if it comes back I will just deal with it, but I know I have all of you to talk with and it is invaluable to have this site.  Thanks to all you gals who are survivors and who are living with this awful disease, I know you are there. nannajean
Posts.Title: breathless and a little worried nannajean nannajean

Posts.Content: nannajean wrote: I had a CT scan, mammogram and U/S of my right breast in January of this year and all my tests came back clear but when I saw my oncologist she said I had a good chance of recurrence and if I became short of breath I should see her.  Well I find when I go for walks and  try to chat with a friend at the same time, or if I walk up hills I am breathless.  I am on Letrozole and had my surgery in 2009, the lump was 2cm and I had 7 positive lymph nodes, +3 est and +3 prog. and aggressive, I had 6 rounds of chemo and 16 rads.  One oncologist said I was a 2b stage and had a 75% chance of being around in 10 years, the other one said that those odd where not that great and I had a significantly higher chance of recurrence.  Since the chemo I have been more short of breath but now I am worried about it. I know that the CT scan would have shown lung cancer if it was there but that was back in January and when I saw the other oncologist in March(8 month checkup) and she was so negative I have been really scared and kind of paranoid. I am wondering if this breathlessness is in my head or if it is part of the effects of meds, chemo, and rads.  Of course I am afraid to go to the doctor, it seems since 2009 I live in doctors offices and I hate it.  I don't want to burden my family of friends as they really have no idea what we go through, only all of you know what it is like because you live it just like me. I want to just forget breast cancer and live a normal life and I wonder if that will ever happen, that damn cancer is always on my mind. Nannajean Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: breathless and a little worried nannajean nannajean
